title: Rito said ppl move on from games. I fully disagree and that statement makes me MAD.
body:
So, during the 8.12 patch one of the Rito devs said and I quote, "people move on from games, its just the nature of videogames."
I 150% disagree with that statement.
Look at WoW, Smash Bros, Warcraft, Starcraft, FFX, FF12, borderlands, all of these classics.

These games didnt become classics because the game kept evolving to the point where the playerbase couldnt even recognize the game.
These games had no need to evolve from release past BUG fixes.
Oh no, they are classics becauise they give the people exactly what they wanted in a videogame.

Yet, you guys sit here and claim that you NEED to keep it fresh, that you NEED to keep it from stagnating.
I say all you need to do is fix bugs. THAT will keep the game fresh enough along with your ALTNERNATE PLAY MODES.
There literally is no reason for all this garbage (patch 8.12)

Now, also, this isnt about, "Oh wtf is this vladimir doing bot lane RIP META RAGE" No.
Im fine with the game opening up for new picks, that is GOOD updates.
What is bad is removing ADCs completely from the game.
Whats bad is being warned by your playerbase, pro and noob alike that 8.12 was too much too fast and yall didnt listen.

Checking streams from twitch (because you guys refuse to release usage stats for your servers) You guys have lost at least 40,000 viewers, giving fortnite a literal 40,000 viewer avg MORE than league.
Prime time has fortnite at over 3x leagues base.

This is proof you dun fucked up guys.
ITs time to admit a mistake and move on to better things...
Or watch everyone whos played league for years move on.

We didnt outgrow your game.

YOU quit listening and have done so for years.

You move on from video games you didnt completely love. Gamers play alot of games.  Most of them are only good for a once through.

Video games you do love stay with you. You might beat it and move on for a little while but u always come back. I still go back and play the old marios and digimon games.  I still put in legend of dragoon or old final fantasy games.  I come back because they are still the game i love.

The tricky part is social games like league.  If you love it you will stick with it.  You also might play it for the multiplayer aspect with friends. If they dont change it though you will always stick with it.  I still play wesnoth, AoE2, dont starve, starcraft, maria kart, and smash bros with friends. I still really enjoy those games. Patches 8.11 and 8.12 are probably the best patches of the season.

I still don't understand why people believe that ADCs have been removed from the game.  Pro play still sees mostly marksmen bot lane and most marksmen still have respectable winrates and pickrates in normal play.  ADCs not being mandatory anymore doesn't mean they are all suddenly garbage tier.

Also, Fortnite is still fresh which is why it has so many more views than League atm on Twitch.  It was the same with Overwatch and the same with PUBG.  After all the little kids get tired of Ninja and this boring Battle Royale stuff, Fortnite will go down past League.  Clearly constantly being in the top 5 games (usually top 3) on Twitch is a sign that League is an awful game.  Makes perfect sense.
People are hardcore overreacting, spreading complete misinformation like "adcs are useless" and such. Gotta love Boards.

In terms of ADC play, you're both completely wrong. Across NA/EU LCS, LCK, LPL, and other professional arenas, the average playrate of ADCs is roughly 32%. Even among that 32%, the only ADCs played are Kai'Sa, Ezreal, Lucian, and Draven, with the occasional Ashe or Miss Fortune. The other scaling marksmen are useless in an early game snowball meta, causing 68% of games to have bruisers or mages instead. Most ADCs mains have no issue with the diversity in bot lane or crit getting nerfed, we have an issue when laners who are stronger than us early and scale into late game are in our lane bullying us out, then hard core anti-ADC players spread lies like "most ADCs have respectable winrates" when 10 ADCs have sub-50% winrates and several others are just barely hovering around 50% (i.e. 50.2-50.4%). Unless the draft calls for an ADC, picking one that isn't a lane bully is a detriment to your team. And with tanks being weak right now, assassins being prevalent, and games lasting 20-25 minutes, its very rare that an ADC is able to be played in a game and expected to win. That isn't going to stop ADC players from trying to play champs we love, but it also doesn't change the fact that ADCs are in a and spot right now, both statistically and in their "feel".

I mained tanks the whole last season, but I have been forced to mostly play bruisers in jungle for the last couple of months. Not a single tank in the jungle is currently strong, unless you count Trundle and maybe Mundo as a tank, and not a bruiser. So my role has arguably suffered even more than yours, yet you don't hear me or barely any other tanks complain. Also, Riot is already preparing buffs for a lot of crit adcs, only two patches after the nerfs. Meanwhile, it can take months for the class I play to actually become somewhat meta again, yet you are still complaining?

Tanks are literally always going to be viable. They may not be as strong as they used to be, but tanks in top lane and tanks in the support role will always have value due to being a damage soak and CC bot. So you're wrong in that aspect. Besides, even if you were right, "I didn't complain why should you" is terrible reasoning. If your class becomes useless in your eyes, you should rightfully he upset. The fact that you show no concern over how your favorite role is treated in the game makes me believe that you're lying about what you main just to make a point. I have never met a single player that doesn't care what happens to their role, and I seriously doubt that you're the exception to the rule.

Of course I care, I'm just not going to super entitled to have my role constantly be in the center of the meta. Tanks can be weak for a while, and I'm fine with that. I've never had a problem with switching champions, and trying out something new, instead of the same champions being meta for years. My patience still has its limits of course, and at some point I will voice my complaint if tanks won't be playable for a long period of times. You know, a long period. Not a single fucking patch.

Your argument about "tanks are literally always going to viable" is also completely invalid, as the exact same can be said for adcs, if not more for adcs (at least invalid in this context).

Also, I never told you that you shouldn't complain, if you have a complaint then voice it for sure. I just heavily dislike how you and most other adcs are completely over exaggerating the issue, begging Riot for buffs even though they have arguably been adc-biased the last many seasons.

You clearly don't understand the issue for ADCs then. Even when weak, tanks will always be playable. As if right now though, the majority of ADCs have very poor win rates while other champs, such as Mordekaiser, Swain, Brand, and Irelia, all have decent play rates while being over a 50% win rate. Nobody cares that they have to switch around who they play, we care when we're literally forced to play other champions because the odds are against us for not conforming. With tanks, you can go from Maokai and Ornn to Doctor Mundo and Ornn (because Ornn is busted, let's be honest). But bot lane, you can go from Caitlyn and Tristana to Draven and Lucian, then still get smashed out of lane by Mordekaiser or Irelia. If an ADC can't make it through lane, they're useless. Tanks will always be viable, even if they get smashed in lane. Damage soaking CC bots will always be able to at least do something, while an ADC that gets smashed in lane is a detriment to the team. My argument is not invalid, you just don't see the clear differences between tanks and ADCs.

"Even when weak, tanks will always be playable".
Yes. Correct. And the exact same thing for adcs. Even when weak, adcs will always be playable. Just because bruisers are suddenly allowed in botlane, hasn't changed the fact adcs aren't playable anymore. Only difference is that tanks are less dependant on gold, since they have a ton of value through their kit, rather than items and auto-attacking. This has nothing to do with them being viable or not in the meta, it is simply how hard they can get snowballed. You're completely unable to see my point, because you somehow think that adcs are unplayable, which they aren't at all.

Let's compare tank playrates to adc playrates, shall we? (Data from op.gg)
We start with Lucian being in the number one spot, with 29.12%, Ezreal in number three with 22.70% and Kai'sa number four with 20.67. Let us scroll down and see the current popular tanks playrate.

So the first real solo-lane tank that isn't Singed is sitting at number 54, 7% pickrate, Malphite. The second most is Shen at 5%.

Don't you think its funny how "Even when weak, tanks will always be playable", yet when tanks are weak they are barely played. Meanwhile, "Even when weak, adcs will always be playable" isn't valid, yet when adcs are weak they are still dominating pick and winrates bot. Almost like the argument is completely invalid. And, look at the patch notes! Adc buffs! But where are the tank buffs? Oh no D:

Play rates mean nothing when comparing ADCs and tanks. Top lane has WAY more variety than bot lane has ever had, even now. Of course the play rates are going to be lower when there's more consistently viable options in the lane, meaning you have more options to counter pick. You're not getting the difference between ADCs and tanks, despite how many times I've said it. "Tanks will always be playable" or "ADC isn't playable" has NOTHING to do with whether or not you can lock in as that kind of champion. It has to do with their game impact. Tanks will always have a spot, no matter how bad they are. They're big, beefy, have CC, and get to work as soon as they're out of lane. They will ALWAYS be playable, even if they get set behind. This means that no matter how far behind they fall, they can still do their jobs and tank up damage and CC enemies. ADCs are BARELY playable right now. There are some exceptions, yes. Lucian, Kai'Sa, Ezreal, and Draven are all doing well. However, with every other ADC, picking them into a bad matchup disallows for then to do their job. They cannot properly DPS without items, and they can't get items if they're shut down in lane. You're ignoring the fundamental differences between ADCs and tanks, and just harping on that no matter how much I say that your comparison is stupid.  As for the buffs, literally only 4 ADCs got buffs. Just as with that, a few got needed, as champs like Kog'Maw, Varus, and Kai'Sa all build Guinsoo's Rageblade in their core build, making them weaker all around. Tanks haven't been buffed because they don't need to be buffed. They're not weak because of nerfs, they're weak because of bruisers and Conqueror. If bruisers that use Conqueror became more situational, tanks would be right back in consistent play. Just like if ADCs got some sustain back and towers weren't made of paper, they'd be right back in consistent play. It's getting very frustrating to argue you because you clearly don't understand what changes make other champions strong or weak, viable or unplayable.

I will have stop this argument because your huge bias towards ADCS makes you impossible to reason with. You talked about how the ADC buffs weren't good enough, and how the problem were bruisers in the botlane, yet you conveniently forget to mention that the two biggest non-adc botlaners right now, Irelia and Vladimir got huge nerfs which will make a lot of adcs way stronger.

Also your argument about Tanks always being viable is still complete and pure bs. You talk like someone who has never played a real tank top or jungle before. Okay, let's say I pick a tank like Rammus in the jungle in Diamond 5 elo. Because some random dude on boards told me they were always viable, so they must be right? Let's say I get matched against Xin Zhao. First of all, I need to be prepared to get invaded at my second buff. I am completely dependent on my teammates, on whether or not I will be able to get it. I will also have to give up every single scuttle in the game. It will be harder for me to gank due to having worse ganks and because I die if Xin counterganks me. I also have to constantly ward both Drake and Herald, since he can solo it, and if he does I won't be able to stop him alone. 

Okay, so I give the entire early game up, because I'm playing a tank, because some dude on Boards told me they were totally viable. Alright, but I will totally outscale him in teamfights right? No. Most tanks in this current meta gets bursted instantly in any teamfights, or just ignored, while the enemy assassins, burstmages and bruisers destroy my entire backline, while there is nothing I can do about it. There is a reason tanks are bad right now, and your argument is based on your personal opinion, not what the actual game state is.

The more I argue with you, the more apparent it becomes that you don't seem to have any actual clue on what the current game-state is. You use shallow arguments like "Tanks will always be viable due to them being tanky and having cc", when that game CLEARLY isn't reflected in the current reality of the meta at all. I usually dislike rank shaming, but I think this lack of basic game knowledge comes from the fact that you're bronze, which means you're either new to the game or doesn't take it seriously at all. I have been playing tanks on a high level for years, and I can tell when they aren't viable in the damn meta no matter what shallow claims you make without actually backing them up with data or reasoning.

I'm done with this argument. Hope you can take something positive away from it, because I sure can't.

I have a bias, sure, but so do you. You're clearly anti-ADC and a huge tank fan. The ADC buffs weren't good enough because only 4 out of however many ADCs got buffed, and 3 got nerfed with Rageblade changes. If you, a tank with CC, are letting assassins and bruisers and other champs run past you and kill your carries, I don't know what to tell you. In your example, Rammus has his Q knock back and his taunt. You can keep an assassin or the enemy Xin Zhao locked up for a couple of seconds while your carries kill him. I didn't get anything out of this argument because you never addressed a thing that I said and constantly ignored what the role of tanks are. There are _reasons_ games succeed; it is not just random, therefore it is not a matter of mere opinion as to why any particular game is successful.  No one understands that better than the players themselves.  I will not tolerate irresponsible excuses like "people will leave" that deny accountability.

Sure you can't keep or please everyone, but don't hide behind that excuse.  A game that listens to its players will not simply die from a decade of age.  A declining playerbase only ever means that you're wrong and should fix yourself.  Neither success nor failure is ever guaranteed.  You're never so ahead that you're allowed to get complacent and devalue your players, and you're never so behind that perseverance, integrity and respect for your players won't uplift you.  Warframe is a beautiful example of the latter.

Also, World of Warcraft has actually been _growing_ for two years straight.  That's because Blizzard has officially announced they are putting a higher emphasis on player feedback and returning things to how they were when they were more successful.  They learned their lesson about placing themselves above their community.  Now, over the years, Riot has become a bit more cynical toward player complaints/disagreement, and more defensive in their decision making.

I support Riot and want to see them continue succeeding.  I intend this all as positive criticism and uplifting encouragement.
